column3: Allowance for Income Taxes, Modified Accrual
column10: The portion of income tax receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Income Taxes Receivable, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Income tax receivable, reported net of allowance for uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
dup_1_Information about special assessment taxes receivable.

column3: Special Assessment Taxes Receivable, Due Within One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Special assessment taxes due to the government entity, derived from state, municipal or school districts, not yet received, due within one year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Allowance for Special Assessment Taxes, Due Within One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: The portion of special assessments receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Special Assessment Taxes Receivable, Due Within One Year, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Special assessment taxes due to the government entity due within one year, derived from state, municipal or school districts, not yet received, reported net of allowance for uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Special Assessments Receivable, Delinquent, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of the balance of special assessments remaining unpaid on and after the date on which a penalty is effective. Detail by special assessment districts and by individual property owners is required. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Special Assessment Taxes Receivable, Unavailable, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of special assessments for which a roll has been prepared and confirmed, but which are not due. Detail by special assessment districts and by individual property owners is required. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about sales tax receivable.
Amount of tax levied upon the sale or consumption of goods that are not yet collected. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Allowance for Sales Taxes, Modified Accrual
column10: The portion of sales tax receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Sales Taxes Receivable, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Sales tax receivable, reported net of allowance for uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about delinquent taxes receivable.
Past due taxes revenues that are not expected to be collected within the normal operating cycle. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Taxes Receivable, Delinquent, Real Property, Modified Accrual
column10: The amount of real property taxes remaining unpaid on and after the date the taxes become delinquent. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Taxes Receivable, Delinquent, Personal Property, Modified Accrual
column10: The amount of personal property taxes remaining unpaid on and after the date becoming delinquent. A detailed account must be maintained for each year's levy. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about other taxes receivable.

Other taxes receivable which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Allowance for Other Taxes Receivable, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for other taxes receivable. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Other Taxes Receivable, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Other taxes receivable, reported net of allowance for uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about taxes receivable.
Amount of taxes levied and related charges which have become due but have not been collected. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Allowance for taxes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Taxes Receivable, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of taxes levied and related charges which have become due but have not been collected, and which are net of uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about interest and penalties receivable.
Information about Penalties Receivable.
Amount of accrued penalties on taxes receivable. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Allowance for Penalties Receivable, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for penalties receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Penalties Receivable, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of accrued penalties on taxes receivable, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Interest and Penalties Receivable on Taxes, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of accrued interest and penalties on taxes receivable. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Payments in Lieu of Taxes Receivable, Modified Accrual
column10: A payment made to compensate a government for some or all of the property tax revenue lost due to tax exempt ownership or use of real property. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Leases Receivable.

column3: Leases Receivable, Due Within One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Represent lease contracts receivable within one year that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Allowance for Leases Receivable, Due Within One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for amount of lease receivable due within one year and estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Leases Receivable, Due Within One Year, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Leases receivables, due within one year, net of uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Grants and Contracts Accounts Receivable.

column3: Grants and Contracts Receivable, Modified Accrual
column10: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of amounts due under the terms of governmental, corporate, or foundation grants; and for amounts due for services rendered or to be rendered, actions taken or to be taken, or a promise to refrain from taking certain actions in accordance with the terms of a legally binding agreement between the entity and, at a minimum, one other party. An example would be amounts associated with contracts or programs where the recognized revenue for performance thereunder exceeds the amounts billed under the terms thereof as of the date of the balance sheet. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Allowance for Grants and Contracts Receivable, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for uncollectible amounts for grants and contracts receivable.

column3: Grants and Contracts Receivable, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Carrying amount, net of uncollectible amounts, as of the balance sheet date of amounts due under the terms of governmental, corporate, or foundation grants; and for amounts due for services rendered or to be rendered, actions taken or to be taken, or a promise to refrain from taking certain actions in accordance with the terms of a legally binding agreement between the entity and, at a minimum, one other party. An example would be amounts associated with contracts or programs where the recognized revenue for performance thereunder exceeds the amounts billed under the terms thereof as of the date of the balance sheet. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about land contract receivables.
Amount of land contracts due to the local unit. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Land Contracts Receivables, Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for land contracts receivable. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Land Contracts Receivables, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of land contracts due to the local unit, net of uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Deposits Receivable.

Amounts that are held to be either applied to future receivables or to be returned to the customers based on agreements. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Allowance for Deposits Receivable, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance of deposits estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Deposits Receivable, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts that are held to be either applied to future receivables or to be returned to the customers based on agreements and which are net of uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Loans and Notes Receivable.

column3: Loans and Notes Receivable, Due Within One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Current amount due to the local government unit on loans or notes that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, and it may be used to record the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local government unit. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Allowance for Loans and Notes Receivable, Due Within One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for loans and notes receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Loans and Notes Receivable, Due Within One Year, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Current amount due to the local government unit on loans or notes that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, and it may be used to record the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local government unit, reported net of uncollectible amounts. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Loans Receivable.

column3: Loans Receivable, Due Within One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Current amount due to the local unit on loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Loans Receivable, Allowance, Due Within One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for loans receivable due within one year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Loans Receivable, Net of Allowance, Due Within One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount due to the local unit on loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, net of uncollectible amounts, due within one year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Notes Receivable.

column3: Notes Receivable, Due Within One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Represents the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local unit, due within one year. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Notes Receivable, Allowance, Due Within One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for notes receivable due within one year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Notes Receivable, Net of Allowance, Due Within One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Represents the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local unit, net allowance for uncollectible amounts, due within one year. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about claims and judgments receivable.

column3: Claims and Judgments Receivable, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount due to the local government unit from claims and judgments but not yet collected. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Allowance for Claims and Judgments Receivable, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for claims and judgments receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Claims and Judgments Receivable, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount due to the local government unit from claims and judgments but not yet collected, net amounts expected to be uncollectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Inter Governmental Receivable.

Inter-governmental receivable is appropriate where one governmental unit transfers resources to another, such as when states transfer shared revenues to local governments or act as an Intermediary in federally financed programs. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Allowance for Inter Governmental Receivable, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for inter governmental receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Inter Governmental Receivable, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Inter-governmental receivable is appropriate where one governmental unit transfers resources to another, such as when states transfer shared revenues to local governments or act as an Intermediary in federally financed programs. This is reported for amounts net of uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about receivables.
Amounts owed by private individuals or organizations for goods and services furnished by a government. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Allowance for receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts owed by private individuals or organizations for goods and services furnished by a government, net of uncollectible amount. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: TOTAL RECEIVABLES

column10: Information about restricted receivable.

Amounts owed by private individuals or organizations for goods and services furnished by a government and restricted as to use. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Allowance for Restricted Receivable, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for restricted receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Receivables, Restricted (Net of Allowance), Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts owed by private individuals or organizations for goods and services furnished by a government and restricted as to use, and net of uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about investment income receivable.

Investment income receivable, which is the compensation for the use of financial resources over a period of time. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Allowance for Investment Income Receivable, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for investment income receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Investment Income Receivable, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Investment income receivable, which is the compensation for the use of financial resources over a period of time, net of uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about other receivables.

Other receivables which the reporting entity does not separately disclose. It is the total due to the entity within one year of the balance sheet date (or one operating cycle, if longer) from outside sources, including trade accounts receivable, notes and loans receivable, as well as any other types of receivables. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: RECEIVABLES, All Other Receivables (Account No 18 - 100) excluding 19 - 70 and 71 - 81

column3: Allowance for Other Receivable, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for other receivable estimated not to be collectible. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Other Receivables, (Net of Allowance), Modified Accrual
column10: Other receivables which the reporting entity does not separately disclose, net of uncollectible amounts. It is the total due to the entity within one year of the balance sheet date (or one operating cycle, if longer) from outside sources, including trade accounts receivable, notes and loans receivable, as well as any other types of receivables, net of allowances established for the purpose of reducing such receivables to an amount that approximates their net realizable value. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Receivables from contracts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about amounts that are due from governments.
Amounts due from cities. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due from counties. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due from libraries. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due from Road Commissions, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts due from road commissions. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due from villages. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due from schools. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due from Townships, Except Road Agreements, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts due from townships for most purposes, except for county road commissions or township road agreements. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due from State Government, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts from due from the State not yet collected. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due from Federal Government, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts due from Federal Government, but not yet collected. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due from Townships, Road Agreements, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts due from due from townships for work performed on roads under agreement signed by the township and the road commission. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due from Other Government, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts due from other government entities that are outside of the government's reporting entity that are not yet collected. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about amounts that are due from other funds.

column3: Due from Enterprise Funds, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts due from enterprise funds within the local government unit. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due from Fiduciary Funds, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts due from fiduciary funds within the local government unit. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due from Other Funds, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts due from other funds within the same reporting entity not yet collected. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: Due from Other Funds (Account No 084)

column3: Due from Component Unit, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts due from component units. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Due from employees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Due from others. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about inventory.

Cost of road materials stockpiled in warehouses, pits or yards which are used for construction or maintenance of the county road system. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Inventory, Equipment Materials and Parts, Modified Accrual
column10: Cost of materials and parts on hand which are used for the repair, maintenance, and operation of equipment. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Inventory which is materials and supplies on hand for future consumption or goods held for resale rather than for use in operations. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: OTHER CURRENT ASSETS, Inventory (Account No 101-110)
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 2200; Paragraph: 176

column3: Inventory and Prepaid Items, Modified Accrual
column10: Prepaid items and inventory which is materials and supplies on hand for future consumption or goods held for resale rather than for use in operations. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Prepaid expenses which is an asset resulting from the payment for goods or services to be received in the future. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: OTHER CURRENT ASSETS, Prepaids (Account 123)

column10: Prepaid deposits which is an asset resulting from the payment for goods or services to be received in the future. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Insurance payments made in advance for insurance coverage. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Other prepaid assets which the reporting entity does not separately disclose. It is an asset resulting from the payment for goods or services to be received in the future. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Prepaid Expenses and Other Assets, Modified Accrual
column10: Prepaid expenses and other assets. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Cash advances to officials and/or employees of the local unit to cover anticipated expenses while traveling in an official capacity for the local unit. Upon completion of the travel, this account must be reimbursed for the entire amount of the advance. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Advances to Other Funds, Current, Modified Accrual
column10: Advances to other funds within the local unit where such advances are due within a year. Examples are advances to a County Drain Revolving Fund for preliminary expenses, advances to a County 100% Tax Payment Fund, advances to an internal service fund, etc. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Advances to Other Governments, Current, Modified Accrual
column10: Advances to other units of government where such advances are due within a year. An example is an advance to a building authority. Sub-accounts must be used where several units are involved. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Advances to Component Unit, Current, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of advances to component units where such advances are due within a year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts of unpaid fines, court costs, restitution, and any other court ordered payments. Subsidiary records or accounts must be kept for these court orders by case number and/or name. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due to the local unit for fees for services for which an account is not provided for elsewhere. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Forfeiture Certificate Recording Fees Receivable, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of forfeiture certificate recording fees due to the county in accordance with 1999 PA 123. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Local Unit Share of Assessment Improvement Costs Receivable, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount due from a local unit as its share of the cost of an improvement financed by special assessments. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Assets Held for Sale, Modified Accrual
column10: Cost of assets that are being held for re-sale. Assets acquired with the intent of reselling should be reported as assets even if capital in nature. However, the carrying value should not exceed the estimated sales proceeds, net of expenditures necessary to ready the asset for sale. An example of assets held for sale could houses purchased to be renovated and resold. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: OTHER CURRENT ASSETS, Assets Held for Sale (Account No 128)

column3: Securities Lending Collateral, Assets, Modified Accrual
column10: Collateral such as cash, securities, or letter of credit received as part of the securities lending transactions the government entity enters into. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Investments of Surplus Funds, Modified Accrual
column10: The cost of long-term investments of surplus funds under 1943 PA 20 (for the governments assets) and 1965 PA 314 (for pension and OPEB trust fund assets). This includes government bonds, treasury bills, treasury notes, municipal bonds, stocks, mortgages, land purchased for investment purposes, etc. A long-term investment is an investment having a maturity date of more than one year from the date of purchase. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

A financial instrument or other contract that meets the definition under GASB Statement No. 53, paragraph 7. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

The accumulated amortization for leases other than short-term leases such as account 182-Lease Assets and contracts that transfer ownership. A lease asset should be amortized in a systematic and rational manner over the shorter of the lease term or the useful life of the underlying asset. The amortization of the lease asset should be reported as an outflow of resources (for example, amortization expense), which may be combined with depreciation expense related to other capital assets for financial reporting purposes. Used on the governmental funds statements, on a modified accrual basis.
Other restricted asset that have been set aside based on contractual or regulatory agreements. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Assets set aside based on contractual or regulatory agreements. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Represents the cost of construction work undertaken but not yet completed. As projects are completed, the cost is transferred from this account to the applicable capital asset account. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Specific costs of services that a regulatory agency permits a U.S. public utility (usually an energy company) to recover in future rates. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Unamortized Discounts on Bonds Sold by Local Unit, Modified Accrual
column10: Unamortized discounts on bonds sold by the local unit, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Other current assets which the reporting entity does not separately disclose. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: TOTAL OTHER CURRENT ASSETS

column10: Cash and other assets or resources commonly identified as those that are reasonably expected to be realized in cash or sold or consumed within a year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about noncurrent assets.

column3: Advances to Other Funds, Noncurrent, Modified Accrual
column10: Advances to other funds within the local unit where such advances are not due within a year. Examples are advances to a County Drain Revolving Fund for preliminary expenses, advances to a County 100% Tax Payment Fund, advances to an internal service fund, etc. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: OTHER LONG TERM ASSETS, Advances to Other Funds (Account No 193)

column3: Advances to Other Governments, Noncurrent, Modified Accrual
column10: Advances to other units of government where such advances are not due within a year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: OTHER LONG TERM ASSETS, Advances to Other Units of Government (Account No 194)

column3: Advances to Component Unit, Noncurrent, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of advances to component units where such advances are not due within a year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Investments in Joint Ventures, Modified Accrual
column10: A financial interest in a joint venture evidenced by the ownership of shares of the joint ventures stock or by otherwise having an explicit, measurable right to the net resources of the joint venture that is usually based on an investment of financial or capital resources by a participating government. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column17: [Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 2100; Paragraph: 508], [Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 140; Paragraph: 102]

column3: Long Term Contracts Receivable, Modified Accrual
column10: Receivables from long term contracts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Lease Assets, Right of Use, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount for lease assets for leases other than short-term leases and contracts that transfer ownership defined by GASB 87. At the commencement of the lease term, a lessee should recognize a lease liability and an intangible right-to-use lease asset a lessee initially should measure the lease asset as the sum of the following: 1) the amount of the initial measurement of the lease liability; 2) lease payments made to the lessor at or before the commencement of the lease term, less any lease lease incentives received from the lessor at or before the commencement of the lease term; 3) initial direct costs that are ancillary charges necessary to place the lease asset into service. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements based on modified accrual.
Information about leases receivable.

Amounts of lease contracts receivable due in more than one year that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Allowance for Leases Receivable, Noncurrent, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for leases receivable, noncurrent. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Lease Receivable, Net, Noncurrent, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of lease contracts receivable due in more than one year, net of allowance for uncollectible amount that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about special assessment taxes receivable, noncurrent.

column3: Special Assessment Taxes Receivable, Noncurrent, Modified Accrual
column10: Special assessment taxes due to the government entity in more than one year, derived from state, municipal or school districts, not yet received. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Allowance for Special Assessment Taxes, Noncurrent, Modified Accrual
column10: The portion of special assessments receivable estimated not to be collectible and that is due in more than one year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Special Assessment Taxes Receivable, Noncurrent, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Special assessment taxes due to the government entity, due in more than one year, derived from state, municipal or school districts, not yet received, reported net of allowance for uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Loans and Notes Receivable.

column3: Loans and Notes Receivable, Due in More than One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount due in more than one year, to the local government unit on loans or notes that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, and it may be used to record the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local government unit. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Allowance for Loans and Notes Receivable, Due in More Than One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for loans and notes receivable estimated not to be collectible, due in more than one year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Loans and Notes Receivable, Due in More Than One Year, Net of Allowance, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount due in more than one year to the local government unit on loans or notes that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, and it may be used to record the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local government unit, reported net of uncollectible amounts. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Loans Receivable.

column3: Loans Receivable, Due in More Than One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount due to the local unit on loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions and that are due in more than one year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Loans Receivable, Allowance, Due in More Than One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for loans receivable, due in more than one year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Loans Receivable, Net of Allowance, Due in More Than One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Current amount due to the local unit on loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, net of uncollectible amounts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Notes Receivable.

column3: Notes Receivable, Due in More Than One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Represents the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local unit, due in more than one year. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Notes Receivable, Allowance, Due in More Than One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Allowance for notes receivable due in more than one year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Notes Receivable, Net of Allowance, Due in More Than One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: dRepresents the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local unit, net allowance for uncollectible amounts, due in more than one year. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

A security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: Long-Term Investments (Account No 111-122)
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 150; Paragraph: 535

column10: The net OPEB Asset is computed as the difference between the actuarial present value of projected benefit payments attributed to past periods of employee service and the OPEB plans fiduciary net position. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: OTHER LONG TERM ASSETS, Net OPEB Asset (Account No 191)

column10: Amount of the excess of net position in a pension plan system to the total pension liability. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: OTHER LONG TERM ASSETS, Net Pension Asset (Account No 190)

column10: Other noncurrent assets. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: TOTAL OTHER LONG TERM ASSETS

column10: Other assets that the local government unit does not separately disclose. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Resources with present service capacity that the government presently controls. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: TOTAL ASSETS

column10: Information about deferred outflows of resources.

column3: Other Deferred Outflows of Resources, Modified Accrual
column10: Other deferred outflows of resources. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Deferred Outflows of Resources, Modified Accrual
column10: Deferred outflows of resources. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: TOTAL DEFERRED OUTFLOWS OF RESOURCES (Account No 195-199)

column3: Assets and Deferred Outflows of Resources, Modified Accrual
column10: Assets and deferred outflows of resources. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: TOTAL ASSETS AND DEFERRED OUTFLOWS OF RESOURCES

column10: Information about liabilities.
Information about Current Liabilities.
Cash overdraft. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Accounts payable is a liability account reflecting amounts owed to private persons or organizations for goods and services received by a government. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amount of drain orders payable during the current fiscal year. Drain orders payable in a subsequent year or years are recorded as a deferred inflow. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Benefits payable. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due and payable related to grants given out by the entity. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amount of the local government unit's liability for taxes incurred but not due until a later date. An example is the local government unit's matching portion of social security on an accrued payroll. Debit upon payment or reversing the entry; credit monthly or at the end of the fiscal year for amounts of accrued taxes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts withheld from employees (other than social security and income taxes) for payments to other agencies. Examples are health and life insurance premiums, credit union deductions, etc. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due and payable to retirees or survivors of retirees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Penalty payments that are due but not yet paid. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Inter-governmental balances payable is appropriate where one governmental unit transfers resources to another, such as when states transfer shared revenues to local governments or act as an Intermediary in federally financed programs. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Claims and Judgments Payable, Modified Accrual
column10: Represents amounts payable by the local unit as a result of a court decision, including condemnation awards and payment for private property taken for public use. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amount of liabilities for materials and services evidenced by vouchers which have been pre-audited and signed by the proper authority approving the liability. Debit upon payment of vouchers; credit for amounts approved for payment. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount of payments related to contracts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Payables for others which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Payables are amounts owed on open accounts to private persons or organizations for goods and services furnished to a government. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about Accrued Liabilities.

Amount of the local government unit's liability for payroll taxes incurred but not due until a later date. Debit upon payment or reversing the entry; credit monthly or at the end of the fiscal year for amounts of accrued taxes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Accrued Benefits and Compensation Long Term, Modified Accrual
column10: Accrued benefits and compensation, long term. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: CURRENT LIABILITIES, Accrued benefits & compensation (Account No 343)

column10: Amount of interest incurred as of the balance sheet date and the penalty payments that are owed by the local government unit. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Accrued Tuition and Fees, Modified Accrual
column10: Accrued tuition and fees. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Accrued expenses payable. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered. Examples include taxes, interest, rent and utilities. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Accrued Wages and Related Liabilities Payable [Abstract]
column10: Information about accrued wages and related liabilities.

Amount of wages earned by employees that are due and payable. Debit upon payment or by reversing the entry; credit for amounts of salaries and wages earned but not paid as of the end of an accounting period. Reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Accrued Wages and Related Liabilities Payable, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of wages earned by employees and related liabilities, that are due at a later date. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: CURRENT LIABILITIES, Accrued Wages and Benefits (Account No 257-261)

column10: Information about compensated absences payable.
Amount of liabilities for unused vacation. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Compensated absences payable are compensated time off such as vacation and sick leave, which has been earned by employees and probable that the employer will compensate the employees through paid time off or some other means, such as cash payments at termination or retirement but not yet compensated by the employer. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Cash paid to the local government unit for goods and services not yet provided to the customers. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: All Other Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities, Modified Accrual
column10: All other accounts payable and accrued current liabilities excluding amounts due to other funds, and accrued wages and benefits. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: CURRENT LIABILITIES, AllOther Accounts Payable and Current Liabilities (Account No 200-299, excluding 214 and 257 - 261)

column10: Amounts for specific revenues or gains that a local government unit to defer to be recognized within the next reporting period. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due to Governments Other than Primary [Abstract]
column10: Information about amounts due to other governments.

column3: Due to Primary Government, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts due to the primary government within the same reporting entity. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column16: publisher: Codification of Governmental Accounting and Financial Reporting Standards, GASB

column10: Amounts due to cities. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due to counties. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due to libraries. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due to Road Commissions, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts due to road commissions. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due to schools. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due to townships. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amounts due to villages. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due to State Government, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts collected for and owed to the State by a local unit of government. Debit for all payments to the State; credit for all amounts owed to the State. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due to Federal Government, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts collected for and owed to the Federal Government by a local unit of government. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due to Other Governments, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts due to other government entities that are outside of the government's reporting entity. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about amounts due to other funds.

column3: Due to Fiduciary Funds, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts collected for and owed to the fiduciary funds within the same reporting entity. Debit for all payments to the fiduciary fund; credit for all amounts owed to the fiduciary fund. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due to Enterprise Funds, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts due to enterprise funds within the same reporting entity. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due to Other Funds, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts due to other funds within the same reporting entity. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due to Component Unit, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts collected for and owed to a component unit by a local unit of government. Debit for all payments to the component unit; credit for all amounts owed to the component unit. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts due to employees of the local unit. Examples are underpayment of salaries, excessive payroll withholding, etc. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due to Fiscal Agent, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts due to fiscal agents such as banks for servicing the local unit's maturing debt principal and interest payments. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due to Former Employees, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts including severance pay, vacation pay, and other benefits due but not paid when employment was terminated. This account may also be used in a local unit retirement fund to record amounts due to members of the retirement system who have resigned or left the system prior to retirement. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due to Intermediate School Districts, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of taxes or other amounts collected for or owed to an intermediate school district. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due to Community College, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of taxes or other amounts collected for or owed to a community college. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due to Special Education, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of tax collections for special education programs. The Intermediate School District normally administers the special education programs within a county. This account may also be used to record any other amounts collected for or owed to a special education program. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due to Court Wards, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts collected for or otherwise due to individuals who are wards of the court. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Due to Taxpayers (Tax Overpayments and Duplicate Payments), Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts to be returned to persons or firms which overpaid taxes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts due to others that the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Deposits Held for Others, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts held by the entity for others to be returned in future periods. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Money deposited with the local unit by contractors, other firms, or individuals to guarantee the performance of a certain act or acts. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Resources received from grantors before eligibility requirements are met. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Advances from Component Unit, Modified Accrual
column10: Advances from component unit, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Advances, Special Assessment Districts, Modified Accrual
column10: Proceeds received from bond issues to finance primary and local road construction and improvements in special assessment districts, and advances or prepayments received from individuals and local units in these districts to finance this work. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Resources received from others. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: LONG-TERM LIABILITIES, Other Advances (Account 328-330, 333)

column10: Amount of payments withheld that are a percentage of milestone payments owed to a subcontractor or vendor pending full completion of project and resolution of any defects. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Provision for Property Tax Refunds, Modified Accrual
column10: Provision for property tax refunds. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts received by the local unit, in accordance with a court order, for subsequent payment to recipients specified in the court order. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Unclaimed money in the possession of the local unit such as outstanding or unclaimed payroll checks and other checks, unclaimed meter deposits, other unclaimed trust, and agency money, etc. Unclaimed money must be reported to the State Treasurer annually. Unclaimed money is considered to be abandoned: 1) attempts to contact the owner fail. If these attempts are unsuccessful, the money is turned over to the State Treasurer where the owner or the owner's heirs may claim it, 2) The due date for the annual unclaimed property report (holder report) is July 1 for property reaching its dormancy period as of March 31. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts received or held by the local unit as a result of the garnishment of wages. These amounts are subsequently paid to parties specified in the garnishment order. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Patients or Inmates Trust Money Payable, Modified Accrual
column10: Personal money being held for patients or inmates while lodged in a local unit facility (medical care facility, hospital, jail, etc.). Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts received by the local unit, usually in accordance with court orders, which are to be subsequently paid to injured parties as restitution as directed by the court orders. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Collections of money for which the proper account is not immediately identifiable. Examples are money received from the state or federal government which is to be distributed to other funds or other units at a later date. Cash disbursements are not to be made from this account. When the proper distribution is determined, amounts must be transferred from this account to the proper account(s). Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts held for various tax collections before analysis and distribution. Cash disbursements are not to be made from this account. When the proper distribution is determined, the amounts must be reclassified from this account to the proper liability account(s) from which disbursements are made.  Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Amounts to be returned to persons or firms that have made overpayments or duplicate payments, other than taxes, to the local unit. Do not report amounts Due to Taxpayers (Tax Overpayments and Duplicate Payments), for overpayments and duplicate payments of taxes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Unamortized Premium on Bonds, Modified Accrual
column10: Excess of proceeds received from the sale of bonds over and above the par value, which remains to be amortized over the remaining life of such bonds (this amount does not include accrued interest to the date of sale), reported on a modified accrual basis.
column11: Unamortized Premium on Bonds at Beginning of Period, Modified Accrual
column12: Unamortized Premium on Bonds at End of Period, Modified Accrual

column10: The portion of land contracts due and payable during the current fiscal year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Notes and Loans Payable, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of the portion of tax anticipation notes or other notes or loans to be paid by the local unit. A note payable is an unconditional written promise signed by the maker (authorized local unit officials) to pay a certain sum of money on demand or at a fixed or determinable time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. Debit for payments made on such notes; credit for the number of notes to be paid during the current year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Leases Payable, Due Within One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Represents lease contracts payable in the current period that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column11: Leases, Due Within One Year, at Beginning of Period
column12: Leases, Due Within One Year, at End of Period

column3: Bonds Payable, Due Within One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: The balance of bonds payable due within one year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Notes Payable, Due Within One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: The portion of tax anticipation notes or other notes to be paid by the local unit during the current year. A note payable is an unconditional written promise signed by the maker (authorized local unit officials) to pay a certain sum of money on demand or at a fixed or determinable time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Represents collections of cash bonds such as appearance bonds and bail bonds, the subsequent repayment of these bonds upon court order to the proper party or to the General Fund upon forfeiture, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Amount for which asset recognition criteria have been met, but the amount has not yet been earned. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: LONG TERM LIABILITIES, Unearned Revenue (Account No 339)

column10: Current liabilities are amount of obligations for items that have entered into the operating cycle incurred in the acquisition of materials and supplies to be used in providing services; collections received in advance of the performance of services. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: TOTAL CURRENT LIABILITIES
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 2200; Paragraph: 181

column10: Information about noncurrent liabilities.

column3: Advances from Other Governments, Noncurrent, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts owed by a local unit of government to another local unit. Debit for any subsequent decreases (repayments) of the advance amounts; credit for amounts of advances received and for any subsequent increases. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Advances from State, Noncurrent, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts owed by a local unit to the State. Detailed sub-accounts should be maintained if more than one advance is received. Debit for any subsequent decreases (repayments) of the advance amounts; credit for amounts of advances received and for any subsequent increases. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Advances from Federal Government, Noncurrent, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts owed by a local unit to the federal government. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Advances from Other Funds, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts owed to other funds of the same local government reporting entity. Examples are long-term loans, advances for services to be performed in the future, and similar items. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Leases Payable, Due in More Than One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Represent lease contracts payable in more than one year that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Bonds Payable, Due in More Than One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of collections of cash bonds such as appearance bonds and bail bonds, the subsequent repayment of these bonds upon court order to the proper party or to the General Fund upon forfeiture. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Notes Payable, Due in More Than One Year, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of all notes of a long-term nature (over one year) owed by the local unit. Debit upon payment of such notes; credit for the face amounts of long-term notes. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column11: Notes Payable, Due in More Than One Year, at Beginning of Period, Modified Accrual
column12: Notes Payable, Due in More Than One Year, at End of Period, Modified Accrual

column3: Securities Lending Obligations, Liability, Modified Accrual
column10: Amount of securities lending obligations. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Regulatory liability. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Derivative instruments, a liability. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Payable from Restricted Assets, Modified Accrual
column10: Amounts owed for goods and services received by a government, payable from restricted assets. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Represents the shortfall of net position in a pension system to the total pension liability and should be measured as the portion of the actuarial present value of projected payments that is attributable to past periods of employee service, net of the pension plans fiduciary net position, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column11: Net Pension Liability at Beginning of Period
column12: Net Pension Liability at End of Period
column14: LONG TERM LIABILITIES, Net Pension Liability (Account No 334)

column10: Noncurrent liabilities are amount of obligations for items that have occured outside the operating cycle incurred in the acquisition of materials and supplies to be used in providing services; collections received in advance of the performance of services. Reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: TOTAL NONCURRENT LIABILITIES
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 2200; Paragraph: 181

column10: Other liabilities which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Liabilities are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

Liabilities are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid. See GASB COD Appendix B under the summary. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Information about deferred inflows of resources

column3: Deferred Inflows of Resources, Taxes Levied for Subsequent Period, Modified Accrual
column10: An acquisition of net assets related to taxes levied that applies to a future reporting period(s). Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Deferred Inflows of Resources, Drain Fund, Modified Accrual
column10: Represents drain orders payable for years subsequent to the current fiscal year. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Deferred Inflows of Resources, Property Taxes, Modified Accrual
column10: An acquisition of net assets related to property tax collection that applies to a future reporting period(s). Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Deferred Inflows of Resources, Special Assessments, Modified Accrual
column10: Deferred inflows of resources, special assessments. Deferred inflows represents an acquisition of net position by the government that is applicable to a future reporting period. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Deferred Inflows of Resources, Unavailable Revenue, Modified Accrual
column10: Unavailable revenue. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Other Deferred Inflows of Resources, Modified Accrual
column10: Other deferred inflows of resources represents an acquisition of net position by the government that is applicable to a future reporting period. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.

column3: Deferred Inflows of Resources, Modified Accrual
column10: Deferred inflows of resources represents an acquisition of net position by the government that is applicable to a future reporting period. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: TOTAL DEFERRED INFLOWS OF RESOURCES (Account No 360-369)

column3: Liabilities and Deferred Inflows of Resources, Modified Accrual
column10: Liabilities and deferred inflows of resources. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: TOTAL LIABILITIES, DEFERRED INFLOWS OF RESOURCES AND FUND BALANCE/NET POSITION

column10: Information about the fund balances.

column3: Investment in Capital Assets, Modified Accrual
column10: Investment in capital assets. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: FUND BALANCE/NET POSITION, (Net) Investment in Capital Assets (Account No 391)

column10: Funds Balanaces Nonspendable
Reflects the portion of fund balance that is not in spendable form for prepaids.
column14: FUND BALANCE/NET POSITION, Nonspendable (Account No 370-374)

column10: Reflects the portion of fund balance that is not in spendable form for inventory.
column14: FUND BALANCE/NET POSITION, Nonspendable (Account No 370-374)
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1800; Paragraph: 166

column3: Fund Balance Nonspendable, Long Term Advances to Other Funds
column10: Reflects the portion of fund balance that is not in spendable form for long term advances to other funds.
column14: FUND BALANCE/NET POSITION, Nonspendable (Account No 370-374)
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1800; Paragraph: 166

column10: Reflects the portion of other fund balance that is not in spendable form (that is, the portion that results from assets that are not spendable - prepaids, inventory, long-term advances to other funds, or other receivables whose collection is not likely in the next year).
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1800; Paragraph: 166

column10: Reflects the portion of fund balance that is not in spendable form (that is, the portion that results from assets that are not spendable - prepaids, inventory, long-term advances to other funds, or other receivables whose collection is not likely in the next year).
column14: FUND BALANCE/NET POSITION, Nonspendable (Account No 370-374)
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1800; Paragraph: 166

column10: Reflects the portion of other fund balance that is legally restricted as to the purposes for which it may be used. Often a funds entire fund balance will be restricted, but sometimes, such as in the General Fund, only a portion will be restricted.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1800; Paragraph: 168

column10: Reflects the portion of fund balance that is legally restricted as to the purposes for which it may be used. Often a funds entire fund balance will be restricted, but sometimes, such as in the General Fund, only a portion will be restricted.
column14: FUND BALANCE/NET POSITION, Restricted (Account No 375-379, 392-398)
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1800; Paragraph: 168

column10: Reflects the portion of other fund balance that is constrained by formal actions of the local units highest level of decision-making authority as to the purposes for which it may be used. Sometimes a funds entire fund balance will be committed, but more often only a portion will be committed.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1800; Paragraph: 170

column10: Reflects the portion of fund balance that is constrained by formal actions of the local units highest level of decision-making authority as to the purposes for which it may be used. Sometimes a funds entire fund balance will be committed, but more often only a portion will be committed.
column14: FUND BALANCE/NET POSITION, Committed (Account No 380-384)
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1800; Paragraph: 170

column10: Represents the portion of other fund balance that is constrained by the governments intent to be used for specific purposes (but are neither restricted nor committed). Sometimes a funds entire fund balance will be assigned, but more often only a portion will be, so this may take additional analysis. These accounts should be pointed off with individual assignments into separate sub-accounts.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1800; Paragraph: 173

column10: Represents the portion of fund balance that is constrained by the governments intent to be used for specific purposes (but are neither restricted nor committed). Sometimes a funds entire fund balance will be assigned, but more often only a portion will be, so this may take additional analysis. These accounts should be pointed off with individual assignments into separate sub-accounts.
column14: FUND BALANCE/NET POSITION, Assigned (Account No 385-389)
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1800; Paragraph: 173

column10: Unassigned fund balance is the residual classification for the general fund. This classification represents fund balance that has not been assigned to other funds and that has not been restricted, committed, or assigned to specific purposes within the general fund. The general fund should be the only fund that reports a positive unassigned fund balance amount. In other governmental funds, if expenditures incurred for specific purposes exceeded the amounts restricted, committed, or assigned to those purposes, it may be necessary to report a negative unassigned fund balance [GASBS 54, 17].
column14: FUND BALANCE/NET POSITION, Unassigned/Restricted (Account No 390-399)
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1800; Paragraph: 177

column10: The difference between governmental fund assets and deferred outflows of resources, and liabilities and deferred inflows of resources, the fund equity, is referred to as fund balance.
column11: Fund Balance at Beginning of Period (Before Adjustment)
column12: Fund Balance at End of Period
column14: OTHER FINANCING USES, Fund Balance/Fund Net Position Beginning Balances; Ending Balances

column2: Governmental Funds Revenues, Expenditures and Changes in Fund Balances
column3: Sub Marginal Land Act, Modified Accrual
column10: The BankheadJones Farm Tenant Act of 1937 (P.L. 75-210) was passed on July 22, 1937[1][failed verification] and authorized acquisition by the federal government of damaged lands to rehabilitate and use them for various purposes. Most importantly, however, the law authorized a modest credit program to assist tenant farmers to purchase land,[1] and it was the culmination of a long effort to secure legislation for their benefit. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
