column10: Information about Accounts Receivable.
Information about Utilities and Water Receivable.

Amounts owed to the local government unit by users of utility services and water services. This account is debited when the amount of utility bills is due; credited when payments are received, or adjustments are approved.
Amount of unpaid utility bills which have been placed on the tax roll in accordance with statutory provisions. A detailed subsidiary account for each resident must be maintained.
Allowance for utilities and water receivable.

column3: Utilities and Water Receivable, Net of Allowance
column10: Amounts owed to the local government unit by users of utility services and water services, including allowance set up for amounts due from individual users that are expected to be uncollectible. This account is debited when the amount of utility bills is due; credited when payments are received, or adjustments are approved.
Information about Connection Fees Receivable.
Connection fees related to utility services provided that have been earned but not yet received.
Allowance for connection fees receivable.

column3: Connection Fees Receivable, Net of Allowance
column10: Connection fees related to utilities that have been earned but not yet received, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts.
Information about tenant accounts receivables.

Cumulative total balance of all tenant charges due, owed and outstanding, such as dwelling rent, maintenance charges, late fees, excess utility charges, and other charges owed to the PHA. This line includes the gross amount due from tenants excluding amounts owed due to participants that committed fraud or misrepresentation and now owe additional rent for periods or retroactive rent.
Allowance for tenant accounts receivable.

column3: Tenant Accounts Receivable, Net of Allowance
column10: Cumulative total balance of all tenant charges due, owed and outstanding, such as dwelling rent, maintenance charges, late fees, excess utility charges, and other charges owed to the local government unit. This line includes the gross amount due from tenants excluding amounts owed due to participants that committed fraud or misrepresentation and now owe additional rent for periods or retroactive rent. Amount reported net of allowance for uncollectible amount.
Information about trade receivable.
Amounts owed to the local government unit from services performed.
Allowance for trade receivable.
Amounts owed to the local government unit from services performed, net of allowance for uncollectible accounts.
Information about unbilled Accounts Receivable.
This account is used to record amounts owed to the local government unit for services performed but not yet billed.
Allowance for accounts receivable, unbilled.

column3: Accounts Receivable, Unbilled, Net of Allowance
column10: This account is used to record amounts owed to the local government unit for services performed but not yet billed, net of allowance for uncollectible accounts.
Information about Other Accounts Receivable.

Not elsewhere classified fees and other revenue recorded based on estimates or specific contractual terms as transactions occur or services are rendered, provided that persuasive evidence exists, the price to the customer is fixed or determinable and collectability is reasonably assured, which have not yet been received as of the balance sheet date.
Allowance for other accounts receivable.

Not elsewhere classified fees and other revenue recorded based on estimates or specific contractual terms as transactions occur or services are rendered, provided that persuasive evidence exists, the price to the customer is fixed or determinable and collectability is reasonably assured, which have not yet been received as of the balance sheet date, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts.
Information about total Accounts Receivable.

Amounts owed to the local government unit from any source. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.
The portion of accounts receivable which is estimated will never be collected.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 2200; Paragraph: 179

column10: Amount, after allowance for credit loss, of accounts and financing receivables, classified as current. Includes, but is not limited to, notes and loan receivable.

Other receivables which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. It is the total due to the entity within one year of the balance sheet date (or one operating cycle, if longer) from outside sources, including trade accounts receivable, notes and loans receivable, as well as any other types of receivables, net of allowances established for the purpose of reducing such receivables to an amount that approximates net realizable value.
column14: All other receivables (Account No 083, 087-088)

column10: Information about receivables.
Amounts owed to the local unit from any source.
column14: TOTAL RECEIVABLES

column10: Allowance for receivables.
This account is used to record amounts owed to the local unit from any source, net of uncollectible amounts.
Information about customer and other government receivables.
Amounts owed to the local government unit from customers and other government units.

column3: Customer and Other Government Receivable, Allowance
column10: Allowance for customer and other government receivable.

column3: Customer and Other Government Receivables, Net of Allowance
column10: Amounts owed to the local government unit from customers and other government units, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts.
Information about Grants and Contracts Accounts Receivable.

Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of amounts due under the terms of governmental, corporate, or foundation grants; and for amounts due for services rendered or to be rendered, actions taken or to be taken, or a promise to refrain from taking certain actions in accordance with the terms of a legally binding agreement between the entity and, at a minimum, one other party. An example would be amounts associated with contracts or programs where the recognized revenue for performance thereunder exceeds the amounts billed under the terms thereof as of the date of the balance sheet.
Allowance for grants and contracts receivable.

column3: Grants and Contracts Receivable, Net of Allowance
column10: Carrying amount, net of allowances for uncollectible amounts, as of the balance sheet date of amounts due under the terms of governmental, corporate, or foundation grants; and for amounts due for services rendered or to be rendered, actions taken or to be taken, or a promise to refrain from taking certain actions in accordance with the terms of a legally binding agreement between the entity and, at a minimum, one other party. An example would be amounts associated with contracts or programs where the recognized revenue for performance thereunder exceeds the amounts billed under the terms thereof as of the date of the balance sheet.
Information about Leases Receivable.

Amount of receivables for short-term leases. GASB 87 indicates that a short-term lease is a lease that, at the commencement of the lease term, has a maximum possible term under the lease contract of 12 months (or less), including any options to extend, regardless of their probability of being exercised. For a lease that is cancelable by either the lessee or the lessor, such as a rolling month-to-month lease or a year-to-year lease, the maximum possible term is the noncancelable period, including any notice periods. The lessee should recognize lease receivable if payments are made in advance. The lessor should recognize lease receivable for rent due if payments are to be received subsequent to the reporting period.
Allowance for leases receivable.

Represent lease contracts receivable, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts, within one year that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction.
Information about Loans Receivable.
Current amount due to the local unit on loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions.
Allowance for loans receivable.
Current amount due to the local unit on loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, net of uncollectible amounts.
Information about Notes Receivable.

Amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local unit. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein.
Allowance for notes receivable.

Amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local unit. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. The amounts recorded in this amount also represent net of allowance for uncollectible amounts.
Information about land contract receivables.
Current portion of land contracts due to the local unit.
Allowance for land contracts receivable.

column3: Land Contracts Receivables, Net of Allowance
column10: Current portion of land contracts due to the local unit, net of uncollectible amounts.
Information about Loans and Notes Receivable.

Current amount due to the local government unit on loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, and it may be used to record the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local government unit. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. This account is debited when the amount of the notes or loans become legal obligations; credited when the payments are received.
Allowance for loans and notes receivable.

column3: Loans and Notes Receivable, Net of Allowance
column10: Current amount due to the local government unit on loans that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, and it may be used to record the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local government unit. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. This account is debited when the amount of the notes or loans become legal obligations; credited when the payments are received. The amounts recorded in this amount also represent net of allowance for uncollectible amounts.
Information about Deposits Receivable.
Amounts that are held to be either applied to future receivables or to be returned to the customers based on agreements.
Allowance for deposits receivable.
Amounts, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts, that are held to be either applied to future receivables or to be returned to the customers based on agreements.
Information about Inter Governmental Receivable.

Inter-governmental receivable is appropriate where one governmental unit transfers resources to another, such as when states transfer shared revenues to local governments or act as an Intermediary in federally financed programs.
Allowance for inter governmental receivable.

column3: Inter Governmental Receivable, Net of Allowance
column10: Inter-governmental receivable, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts, is appropriate where one governmental unit transfers resources to another, such as when states transfer shared revenues to local governments or act as an Intermediary in federally financed programs.
Information about Penalties Receivable.
Amount of accrued penalties on taxes receivable. This account is debited when the amount of penalties is accrued on taxes receivable each month; and credited when penalties are collected.
Allowance for penalties receivable.

Amount of accrued penalties on taxes receivable, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts. This account is debited when the amount of penalties is accrued on taxes receivable each month; and credited when penalties are collected.
Information about claims and judgments receivable.
Amount due to the local government unit from claims and judgments but not yet collected.
Allowance for claims and judgments receivable.

column3: Claims and Judgments Receivable, Net of Allowance
column10: Amount due to the local government unit from claims and judgments but not yet collected, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts.
Information about Leases Receivable.

Amount of receivables for short-term leases. GASB 87 indicates that a short-term lease is a lease that, at the commencement of the lease term, has a maximum possible term under the lease contract of 12 months (or less), including any options to extend, regardless of their probability of being exercised. For a lease that is cancelable by either the lessee or the lessor, such as a rolling month-to-month lease or a year-to-year lease, the maximum possible term is the noncancelable period, including any notice periods. The lessee should recognize lease receivable if payments are made in advance. The lessor should recognize lease receivable for rent due if payments are to be received subsequent to the reporting period.
Allowance for leases receivable.

Represent lease contracts receivable, net of allowance for uncollectible amounts, within one year that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction.
Information about government claims receivable.
Amounts due from a state or other governmental entity withing one year which have not yet been received as of the balance sheet date.
Allowance for government claims receivable.

column3: Government Claims Receivable, Net of Allowance
column10: Amounts due from a state or other governmental entity withing one year which have not yet been received as of the balance sheet date., net of allowance for uncollectible amounts.
Information about tuition and fees receivable.
Carrying amounts of tuition and other associated fees, for example, registration as of the balance sheet date.
The portion of tuition and fees receivable estimated not to be collectible.

column3: Tuition and Fees Receivable, Net of Allowance
column10: Carrying amounts of tuition and other associated fees, for example, registration as of the balance sheet date, net of allowance of uncollectible amounts.
Information about accrued interest receivable.
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of interest earned but not received. Also called accrued interest or accrued interest receivable.
The portion of interest receivable estimated not to be collectible.

column3: Accrued Interest Receivable, Net of Allowance
column10: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of interest earned but not received, amount net of allowance for uncollectible amount. Also called accrued interest or accrued interest receivable.
Information about assessments receivable.
Special assessments due within one year but not yet collected as of the balance sheet date.
The portion of assessments receivable estimated not to be collectible.
Special assessments due within one year but not yet collected as of the balance sheet date. Amounts are net of uncollectible.
Information about Taxes Receivable.
Income tax receivable which are taxes derived from state income tax not yet received.
Amount of uncollected portion of special assessments a government unit has levied. It represents the amount due within one year and not yet considered delinquent.
Amount of special assessments for which a roll has been prepared and confirmed, but which are not due. Detail by special assessment districts and by individual property owners is required.
Amount of tax levied upon the sale or consumption of goods that are not yet collected.
Other taxes receivable which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.
Information about Property Taxes Receivable.

Portion of the real property taxes levied which have become due but have not been returned to the county treasurer as delinquent. This account is debited for the amount of the current real property taxes levied on the day the taxes become due and receivable; credited upon receipt of current real property taxes and with the amount transferred to delinquent taxes at the time taxes become delinquent.
The portion of property taxes receivable estimated not to be collectible.

column3: Property Taxes Receivable, Net of Allowance
column10: Portion of the real property taxes levied which have become due but have not been returned to the county treasurer as delinquent. This account is debited for the amount of the current real property taxes levied on the day the taxes become due and receivable; credited upon receipt of current real property taxes and with the amount transferred to delinquent taxes at the time taxes become delinquent. Amount is net of allowance for uncollectible amount.

column3: Personal and Real Property Taxes Receivable [Abstract]
column10: Information about Personal Property Taxes Receivable.

column3: Taxes Receivable, Personal Property, Current Levy
column10: The portion of personal property taxes levied which have become due but have not become delinquent.

column3: Taxes Receivable, Real Property, Current Levy
column10: The portion of the real property taxes levied which have become due but have not been returned to the county treasurer as delinquent.
Information about delinquent taxes receivable.
The amount of real property taxes remaining unpaid on and after the date the taxes become delinquent.
The amount of personal property taxes remaining unpaid on and after the date becoming delinquent. A detailed account must be maintained for each year's levy.

Amount of the balance of special assessments remaining unpaid on and after the date on which a penalty is effective. Detail by special assessment districts and by individual property owners is required.

Amount of taxes remaining unpaid on and after the date the taxes become delinquent. This account is debited when the amount of taxes is returned delinquent; credited upon receipt of delinquent taxes and when amounts are charged back to local units.
Amount of taxes levied and related charges which have become due but have not been collected.

column3: Interest and Penalties Receivable on Taxes
column10: Amount of accrued interest and penalties on taxes receivable.

column3: Payments in Lieu of Taxes Receivable
column10: A payment made to compensate a government for some or all of the property tax revenue lost due to tax exempt ownership or use of real property.

Cash advances to officials and/or employees of the local unit to cover anticipated expenses while traveling in an official capacity for the local unit. Upon completion of the travel, this account must be reimbursed for the entire amount of the advance.
Amounts of unpaid fines, court costs, restitution, and any other court ordered payments. Subsidiary records or accounts must be kept for these court orders by case number and/or name.
Amounts due to the local unit for fees for services for which an account is not provided for elsewhere.
Amount of forfeiture certificate recording fees due to the county in accordance with 1999 PA 123.

column3: Local Unit Share of Assessment Improvement Costs Receivable
column10: Amount due from a local unit as its share of the cost of an improvement financed by special assessments.
Amounts due from the primary government that are not yet collected.
Information about amounts that are due from governments.
Amounts due from cities.
Amounts due from counties.
Amounts due from libraries.
Amounts due from road commissions.
Amounts due from schools.

column3: Due from Townships, Except Road Agreements
column10: Amounts due from townships for most purposes, except for county road commissions or township road agreements.
Amounts due from villages.
Amounts from due from the State not yet collected. This account is debited when the amount due the local unit from the state is determined; credited when payments are received.

Amounts from due from the federal government not yet collected. This account is debited when the amount due the local unit from the federal government is determined; credited when payments are received.
Amounts due from due from townships for work performed on roads under agreement signed by the township and the road commission.
Amounts due from other government entities that are outside of the government's reporting entity that are not yet collected.
column14: Due from other governments & units (Account No 071-081)

column10: Amounts due from government entities that are outside of the government's reporting entity that are not yet collected.
Information about amounts that are due from other funds.

Short-term amounts due from fiduciary funds within the local government unit. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. This account is debited when the amounts owed from other funds are determined; credited when amounts are received from other funds.

Short-term amounts due from a custodial fund within the local government unit. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. This account is debited when the amounts owed from other funds are determined; credited when amounts are received from other funds.

Short-term amounts due from enterprise funds within the local government unit. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. This account is debited when the amounts owed from other funds are determined; credited when amounts are received from other funds.

Short-term amounts due from tax collection funds within the local government unit. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. This account is debited when the amounts owed from other funds are determined; credited when amounts are received from other funds.

Activity between funds of the primary government, including blended component units. Interfund activities are divided into two broad categories: reciprocal and nonreciprocal. Reciprocal interfund activity comprises interfund loans and interfund services provided and used. Nonreciprocal interfund activity comprises interfund transfers and interfund reimbursements.
column17: Publisher: GASB Codification; Name: Codification; Section: 1800; Paragraph: 102

column10: Amounts due from other funds within the same reporting entity not yet collected. This account is debited when the amounts owed from other funds are determined; credited when amounts are received from other funds.
column14: Due from other funds (Account No 084)

column10: Amounts due from related parties including affiliates, employees, joint ventures, officers and stockholders, immediate families thereof, and pension funds within one year.
Amounts due from local unit employees for reimbursable goods or services provided to or on behalf of the employees.

Short-term amounts due from component units. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. This account is debited when the amounts owed from other funds are determined; credited when amounts are received from other funds.

Short-term amounts due from a retirement system fund within the local government's reporting entity. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. This account is debited when the amounts owed from other funds are determined; credited when amounts are received from other funds.

Inventories are carried at cost and consist of tickets for games in progress not yet sold to retailers and tickets for future games. The cost of tickets is charged to operations when the tickets are sold to retailers. The cost of unissued and returned tickets is written off at the end of each game.
Prepaid deposits which is an asset resulting from the payment for goods or services to be received in the future.
Prepaid expenses which is an asset resulting from the payment for goods or services to be received in the future.
column14: OTHER CURRENT ASSETS Prepaids (Account No 123)

column10: Specific costs of service that a regulatory agency permits a U.S. public utility (usually an energy company) to recover in future rates.
Assets resulting from the payments for goods or services to be received in the future.
Information about inventory.
Cost of road materials stockpiled in warehouses, pits or yards which are used for construction or maintenance of the county road system.
Cost of materials and parts on hand which are used for the repair, maintenance, and operation of equipment.
Inventories, classified as current, which are materials and supplies on hand for future consumption or goods held for resale rather than for use in operations.
column14: OTHER CURRENT ASSETS, Inventory (Account 101-110)
column17: Publisher: GASB Codification; Name: Codification; Section: 140; Paragraph: 102

column10: Cost of assets that are being held for re-sale. Assets acquired with the intent of reselling should be reported as assets even if capital in nature. However, the carrying value should not exceed the estimated sales proceeds, net of expenditures necessary to ready the asset for sale. An example of assets held for sale could houses purchased to be renovated and resold.
column14: OTHER CURRENT ASSETS, Assets Held for Sale (Account No 128)
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: D40; Paragraph: 103

column10: Revenue associated with goods and services provided by any Vendor to its customers that has not been invoiced or billed to such customers.
Collateral such as cash, securities, or letter of credit received as part of the securities lending transactions the government entity enters into.

A financial instrument or other contract that has all of the following characteristics: a. Settlement factors. It has (1) one or more reference rates and (2) one or more notional amounts or payment provisions or both. b. Leverage. It requires no initial net investment or an initial net investment that is smaller than would be required for other types of contracts that would be expected to have a similar response to changes in market factors. c. Net settlement. Its terms require or permit net settlement, it can readily be settled net by a means outside the contract, or it provides for delivery of an asset that puts the recipient in a position not substantially different from net settlement.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: D40; Paragraph: 103

column10: An advance of loan proceeds provided to the developers to pay for eligible costs.
Amounts advanced to contractors.
Other current assets which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement.
column14: TOTAL OTHER CURRENT ASSETS

column10: Cash and other assets or resources commonly identified as those that are reasonably expected to be realized in cash or sold or consumed within a year.
column17: Publisher: GASB Codification; Name: Codification; Section: 1800; Paragraph: 109

column10: Information about current and noncurrent restricted assets.
Information about restricted assets.
Cash and investments whose use in whole or in part is restricted for the long-term, generally by contractual agreements or regulatory requirements.
Securities that are set aside to satisfy contractual or regulatory requirements.
Information about restricted cash and cash equivalents.

Amount of cash restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Restrictions may include legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against short-term borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or company statements of intention with regard to particular deposits.

Amount of nonnegotiable (redemption terms that do not consider market rates) certificates of deposit held by the local government unit treasurer or financial institution that are set aside to satisfy contractual or regulatory requirements.
Represents cash and cash equivalents, restricted. Restricted assets should be reported when restrictions on asset use change the nature or normal understanding of the availability of the asset.

column3: Restricted Accounts Receivable, Net of Allowance
column10: Amounts owed to the local government unit from any source and which are restricted as to use, and net of allowance for uncollectible amount. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.
Amounts restricted for bonds and interest redemption.
Amount restricted in accordance with the bond trust agreement(s).
Proceeds from bond issuances.

column3: Restricted Cash Repairs, Replacement and Improvements Reserve
column10: Amounts set aside specifically to repair, replace and improve capital projects in accordance with the bond trust agreement(s).

Deposits and amounts owed to the local government unit from any source and which are restricted as to use, and net of allowance for uncollectible amount. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.
Amounts set aside to pay for debt service in accordance with the bond trust agreement(s).
Amounts set aside to retire debt(s) in accordance with the bond trust agreement(s).
Other assets that are considered restricted and are set aside based on contractual or regulatory agreements.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 2200; Paragraph: 180

column10: Assets set aside based on contractual or regulatory agreements.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 2200; Paragraph: 180

column10: Information about restricted assets, classified as noncurrent.

Amount of cash restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Restrictions may include legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against long-term borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or company statements of intention with regard to particular deposits.

column3: Restricted Cash and Cash Equivalents, Noncurrent
column10: Amounts of cash and cash equivalents that are restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Restrictions may include legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against long-term borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or company statements of intention with regard to particular deposits.

column3: Restricted Cash and Pooled Investments, Noncurrent
column10: Amounts of cash and pooled investments that are restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Restrictions may include legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against long-term borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or company statements of intention with regard to particular deposits.

Amounts of cash and investments that are restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Restrictions may include legally restricted deposits held as compensating balances against long-term borrowing arrangements, contracts entered into with others, or company statements of intention with regard to particular deposits.
Investments that are restricted as to withdrawal or usage.

column3: Cash and Investments in Segregated Accounts
column10: Cash and investments in segregated accounts.
Special assessment revenue that are restricted as to usage due to the local government unit that will be collected in future reporting periods.
Restricted revenue earned but not yet received.

column3: Receivables and Other Restricted Assets, Noncurrent
column10: Total assets that cannot be used for operating purposes because of contract or regulatory requirements that are in effect for a period that extends beyond one year.

column3: Restricted Assets, Due from Other Governments, Noncurrent
column10: Amounts deemed to be noncurrent that are owed to the local government unit from another government unit outside of the reporting entity and which are restricted as to use. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.
Assets set aside based on contractual or regulatory agreements, that are noncurrent.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 2200; Paragraph: 180

column10: Information about noncurrent assets.

Amounts due from the federal government in more than one year. This account is debited when the amount due the local unit from the federal government is determined; credited when payments are received.
Amounts due from the state government in more than one year. This account is debited when the amount due the local unit from the federal government is determined; credited when payments are received.

Due from other government entities that the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note for amounts due in more than one year. This account is debited when the amount due the local unit from other government entities is determined; credited when payments are received.

Amounts due in more than one year from component units. It represents amounts owed for goods and services rendered to a particular fund by another fund in the government reporting entity or for interfund loans that are due within one year. An offsetting liability must be recorded in the fund from which the payment is due. This account is debited when the amounts owed from other funds are determined; credited when amounts are received from other funds.

Amount of the nonnegotiable (redemption terms that do not consider market rates) certificates of deposit(s) held by the local government unit treasurer or financial institution that will not be redeemed within the normal reporting cycle.
Long-term connection fees related to utility services provided that have been earned but not yet received.
Past due taxes revenues that are not expected to be collected within the normal operating cycle. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of interest earned but not received on delinquent taxes.
Information about advances, noncurrent.

Advances to other funds within the local government unit where such advances are not due within a year. Debit for amounts advanced to other funds; credit for the repayments of any portion of such advances.
column14: OTHER LONG TERM ASSETS, Advances to Other Funds (Account 193)

column10: Amount of advances to the primary government from other funds or component units within the same reporting entity. Debit for amounts advanced to primary governments; credit for the repayments of any portion of such advances.
Amount of advances to other units of government where such advances are not due within a year. An example is an advance to a building authority.
column14: OTHER LONG TERM ASSETS, Advances to Other Units of Government (Account No 194)

column10: Amount of advances to component units where such advances are not due within a year. Debit for the amounts advanced by the local unit to another unit credit for the repayment of any portion of such advances.

column3: Advances to Developers, Net of Current Portion
column10: An advance of loan proceeds provided to the developers to pay for eligible costs to be repaid in future reporting periods .

Amount of advances to other entities where such advances are not due within a year. Debit for the amounts advanced by the local unit to another unit credit for the repayment of any portion of such advances.
Information about accounts receivable, noncurrent.

Amounts owed in more than one year to the local government unit from any source. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.
Allowance for accounts receivable, noncurrent.

Amounts owed in more than one year to the local government unit from any source, net of allowance for uncollectible amount. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.
Information about grants and contracts receivable.

Amounts owed in more than one year to the local government unit from grants or contractual activities. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.

column3: Allowance for Grants and Contracts Receivable, Noncurrent
column10: Allowance for grants and contracts receivable, noncurrent.

column3: Grants and Contracts Receivable, Net of Allowance, Noncurrent
column10: Amounts owed in more than one year to the local government unit from grants or contractual activities, net of allowance for uncollectible amount. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.
Information about leases receivable.

Amounts of lease contracts receivable due in more than one year that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction.
Allowance for leases receivable, noncurrent.

Amount of lease contracts receivable due in more than one year, net of allowance for uncollectible amount that convey control of the right to use another entity's nonfinancial asset (the underlying asset) as specified in the contract for a period of time in exchange or exchange-like transaction.
Information about notes and loans receivable.

The amount due to the local government unit on loans and notes that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, and it may be used to record the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local government unit. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. This account is debited when the amount of the notes or loans become legal obligations; credited when the payments are received.

column3: Allowance for Notes and Loans Receivable, Noncurrent
column10: Allowance for notes and loans receivable, noncurrent.

column3: Notes and Loans Receivable, Net, Noncurrent
column10: The amount due to the local government unit on loans and notes that have been made in accordance with statutory provisions, and it may be used to record the amount due on any legal note that has been accepted by the local government unit. It represents an unconditional written promise, signed by the maker, to pay a certain sum on demand or at a fixed or determinable future time either to the bearer or to the order of a person designated therein. This account is debited when the amount of the notes or loans become legal obligations; credited when the payments are received. This amount is net of allowance for uncollectible amount.
The portion of a receivable from a contractual agreement which will not be realized within a one-year period.
The fair market value of any derivatives contracts, in accordance with GASB Statement 53.

This account is used to record amounts owed in more than one year to the local government unit from grants or contractual activities, net of allowance for uncollectible amount. This account is debited when amounts owed to the local unit are determined but not immediately received; credited when amounts are received or written off by proper authority.

Amount of the uncollected portion of special assessments a government unit has levied. It represents the amount due in more than one year and not yet considered delinquent. Subsidiary accounts may be established for various types or various years of special assessments. Detail by special assessment districts and by individual property owners is required. This account is debited for the amount of the special assessment levy on the day it becomes due and receivable, and credited when the special assessments are collected or when the account balance is considered to be delinquent.
Amounts owed to the local government unit that are not expected to be collected within the normal operating cycle.
Capital and lateral fee revenues earned by the local government unit but not yet collected.

Inventories, classified as noncurrent, which are the aggregate of the items of tangible personal property that (a) are held for sale in the ordinary course of operations, (b) are in process of production for such sale, or (c) are to be currently consumed in the production of goods or services to be available for sale.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 140; Paragraph: 102

column10: Information about noncurrent investments.
Investments held for endowment.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 140; Paragraph: 102

column10: A financial interest in a joint venture evidenced by the ownership of shares of the joint ventures stock or by otherwise having an explicit, measurable right to the net resources of the joint venture that is usually based on an investment of financial or capital resources by a participating government.
column17: [Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 2100; Paragraph: 508], [Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 140; Paragraph: 102]

column10: The cost of long-term investments of surplus funds under 1943 PA 20 (for the governments assets) and 1965 PA 314 (for pension and OPEB trust fund assets). This includes government bonds, treasury bills, treasury notes, municipal bonds, stocks, mortgages, land purchased for investment purposes, etc. A long-term investment is an investment having a maturity date of more than one year from the date of purchase.

Investments in subsidiaries, which is the amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.

Investments in associates, which is the amounts pertaining to a security or other asset that (a) a government holds primarily for the purpose of income or profit and (b) has a present service capacity based solely on its ability to generate cash or to be sold to generate cash.

Other investments which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Investment income is the compensation for the use of financial resources over a period of time.
column14: OTHER LONG TERM ASSETS, Other Investments (Account 180-194)

column10: The total amount of investments that are intended to be held for an extended period of time (longer than one operating cycle).
column14: Long-Term Investments (Account No 111-122)
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 140; Paragraph: 102

column10: Assets owned by the local government unit but held by another government unit outside of the reporting entity.
Lottery prize reserves.
Regulatory assets, classified as noncurrent.

Information about capital assets, which includes land, improvements to land, buildings, building improvements, vehicles, machinery, equipment, works of art and historical treasures, infrastructure, and all other tangible or intangible assets that are used in operations and that have initial useful lives extending beyond a single reporting period.
Information about property, plant and equipment, net.
Information about property, plant and equipment, gross.
Information about buildings and equipment.
Information about buildings and improvements.

Amount before accumulated depreciation of building structures held for productive use including addition, improvement, or renovation to the structure, including, but not limited to, interior masonry, interior flooring, electrical, and plumbing.
Amount before accumulated depreciation of additions or improvements to assets held under a lease arrangement.

Facility held for productive use including, but not limited to, office, production, storage and distribution facilities and any addition, improvement, or renovation to the structure, for example, but not limited to, interior masonry, interior flooring, electrical, and plumbing.

Amount before accumulated depreciation of building structures held for productive use including addition, improvement, or renovation to the structure, including, but not limited to, interior masonry, interior flooring, electrical, and plumbing.
Information about equipment.
The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of equipment of a more or less permanent nature used in road work such as motor graders, cranes, rollers, etc.
The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of machinery and equipment of a more or less permanent nature used in a repair and maintenance shop.
The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of equipment of a more or less permanent nature used in the engineering department.
The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of equipment of a more or less permanent nature used for yard or storage purposes such as gasoline pumps and meters, fuel storage tanks, etc.

Amount before accumulated depreciation of equipment commonly used in offices and stores that have no permanent connection to the structure of a building or utilities. Examples include, but are not limited to, desks, chairs, tables, and bookcases.
Amount before accumulated depreciation of tangible personal property used to produce goods and services, including, but not limited to, tools, dies and molds, computer and office equipment.

Amount before accumulated depreciation of equipment commonly used in offices and stores that have no permanent connection to the structure of a building or utilities. Examples includes machinery, furniture, fixtures, vehicles, computers, electronic devices, and office machines.

Amount before accumulated depreciation of building structures held for productive use including addition, improvement, or renovation to the structure, including, but not limited to, interior masonry, interior flooring, electrical, and plumbing. Used for amounts on the governmental funds statements, reported on a modified accrual basis.
column14: CAPITAL ASSETS, Building & equipment (Account No 136-147)

column10: The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of all vehicles and equipment that are required to have a license plate such as cars, trucks, etc.
The cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of books, publications, journals, and similar items if significant in value and with a useful life of more than one year.

Cost or acquisition value (if acquired by gift) of natural resources which diminish in value by the removal of contents such as gravel pits, stone quarries, timber stands, brine wells, gas and oil wells, etc.
Information about infrastructure.
Amount of cost of acquisition or constructions of water mains and pipe connections.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1400; Subsection: 103

column10: Amount of cost of acquisition of meters.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1400; Subsection: 103

column10: Plant owned by a utility entity used in the operations of the entity.
Information about water and sewer systems.

The cost of construction or acquisition of a water system. This account may be pointed off to separate the various elements of a water system such as water lines, water mains, pumping plant, water treatment plant, etc.

The cost of construction or acquisition of a water system. This account may be pointed off to separate the various elements of a water system such as water lines, water mains, pumping plant, water treatment plant, etc.
Amount of the cost of construction or acquisition of water and sewer systems.

Infrastructure assets are long-lived capital assets that normally are stationary in nature and normally can be preserved for a significantly greater number of years than most capital assets. Examples of infrastructure assets include roads, bridges, tunnels, drainage systems, water and sewer systems, dams, and lighting systems.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1400; Subsection: 103

column3: Property Plant and Equipment, Not Depreciated [Abstract]
column10: Information about property, plant and equipment, not depreciated.
Information about land and construction in progress.

Cost of land purchased by the local unit. Land acquired by gift or grant should be recorded at acquisition value. Road commissions also use this account to record the acquisition cost of land for road purposes. The cost of land includes legal fees, land surface leveling, debris removal, and other costs necessary to place the land in service.

Construction in progress is used to record the cost of construction work undertaken but not yet completed. As projects are completed, the cost is transferred from this account to the applicable capital asset account.
Land is used to record the cost of land purchased by the local government unit. Construction in progress is used to record the cost of construction work undertaken but not yet completed.
Information about land and improvements.

Cost of land purchased by the local unit. Land acquired by gift or grant should be recorded at acquisition value. Road commissions also use this account to record the acquisition cost of land for road purposes. The cost of land includes legal fees, land surface leveling, debris removal, and other costs necessary to place the land in service.

Amount reported by a county road commission to record the actual cost of land improvements from construction and/or reconstruction projects. This work includes excavation, ditching, grading (lane widened portion and/or elevation change only), tree removal, and sub-grade preparation of land in preparation for roadway.
Amount of cost of permanent improvements, other than buildings, which add value to the land. Examples are fences, sewers, sidewalks, pavements, retaining walls, and landscaping.

Land is used to record the cost of land purchased by the local government unit. Land improvements is used to record depreciating or non-depreciating improvements. Depreciating records the cost of permanent improvements, other than building which add value to the land. Non-depreciating records improvements from construction and/or reconstruction projects.
column14: CAPITAL ASSETS, Land & improvements (Account 130-135)

column3: Land, Construction in Progress and Other Non Depreciable Assets
column10: Land is used to record the cost of land purchased by the local government unit. Construction in progress is used to record the cost of construction work undertaken but not yet completed. This account also includes other assets that are not depreciable.

Amount before accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.
Information about accumulated depreciation and depletion.

column3: Accumulated Depreciation, Buildings, Building Additions, and Improvements
column10: Amount of accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of buildings and improvements.
Accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of unlicensed road equipment.
The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of shop machinery and equipment.
The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of engineering equipment.

column3: Accumulated Depreciation, Yard and Storage Equipment
column10: The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of yard and storage equipment.

column3: Accumulated Depreciation, Office Equipment and Furniture
column10: The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of office equipment and furniture.
The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of licensed vehicles and equipment.

column3: Accumulated Depreciation, Books and Related Materials
column10: The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of books and similar items.
The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of a water system.
The accumulation of periodic credits made to record the expiration of the estimated service life of a water system.
Amount of accumulation of periodic decreases in the estimated service life of land improvements due to wear and tear, deterioration, action of the physical elements, inadequacy, and obsolescence.
Accumulation of periodic credits made to record the removal of natural resources.
The accumulation of systematic and rational allocations of the estimated cost of using assets, on a historical basis, over the useful life of the assets.
column11: Accumulated Depreciation, Beginning of Period
column12: Accumulated Depreciation, End of Period

column3: Property, Plant and Equipment, Net of Depreciation
column10: Amount after accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business to produce goods and services and not intended for resale. Examples include, but are not limited to, land, buildings, machinery and equipment, office equipment, and furniture and fixtures.
Information about intangible assets.
Information about intangible assets, before amortization.
Amount of computer software that should be considered as part of capital assets.

A patent is a form of intellectual property that gives its owner the legal right to exclude others from making, using, selling and importing an invention for a limited period of years, in exchange for publishing an enabling public disclosure of the invention.
Timber rights are an interest in a property's timber that allows one to buy or sell the interest in the timber separately from the land.

A trademark is a type of intellectual property consisting of a recognizable sign, design, or expression which identifies products or services of a particular source from those of others, although trademarks used to identify services are usually called service marks.
Water rights are the right to legally appropriate water and put it to beneficial use now and in the future.

Amount of easements related to right of ways. Right of way easements are considered intangible assets. A permanent right-of-way easement is an example of an intangible asset that should be considered to have an indefinite useful life. Intangible assets with indefinite useful lives should not be amortized.
The right to use obtain the economic benefit from the use of an asset owned by another entity.

Assets with an initial useful life that extends beyond a single reporting period that lack physical substance and that are neither financial in nature (neither a monetary asset nor a claim to a monetary asset) nor primarily held for the purpose of directly obtaining income or profit.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1400; Paragraph: 138

column10: The aggregate expense charged against earnings to allocate the cost of intangible assets (nonphysical assets not used in production) in a systematic and rational manner to the periods expected to benefit from such assets.

column3: Intangible Assets, Net of Accumulated Amortization
column10: Assets after accumulated amortization with an initial useful life that extends beyond a single reporting period that lack physical substance and that are neither financial in nature (neither a monetary asset nor a claim to a monetary asset) nor primarily held for the purpose of directly obtaining income or profit.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1400; Paragraph: 138

column10: Information about lease assets.

Amount for lease assets for leases other than short-term leases and contracts that transfer ownership defined by GASB 87. At the commencement of the lease term, a lessee should recognize a lease liability and an intangible right-to-use lease asset a lessee initially should measure the lease asset as the sum of the following: 1) the amount of the initial measurement of the lease liability; 2) lease payments made to the lessor at or before the commencement of the lease term, less any lease lease incentives received from the lessor at or before the commencement of the lease term; 3) initial direct costs that are ancillary charges necessary to place the lease asset into service.

The accumulated amortization for leases other than short-term leases such as account 182-Lease Assets and contracts that transfer ownership. A lease asset should be amortized in a systematic and rational manner over the shorter of the lease term or the useful life of the underlying asset. The amortization of the lease asset should be reported as an outflow of resources (for example, amortization expense), which may be combined with depreciation expense related to other capital assets for financial reporting purposes.

column3: Lease Assets, Right of Use, Net of Accumulated Amortization
column10: Amount for lease assets for leases other than short-term leases and contracts that transfer ownership defined by GASB 87. At the commencement of the lease term, a lessee should recognize a lease liability and an intangible right-to-use lease asset a lessee initially should measure the lease asset as the sum of the following: 1) the amount of the initial measurement of the lease liability; 2) lease payments made to the lessor at or before the commencement of the lease term, less any lease lease incentives received from the lessor at or before the commencement of the lease term; 3) initial direct costs that are ancillary charges necessary to place the lease asset into service. Reported net of accumulated amortization.
Information about assets held for sale.
Held for sale assets are noncurrent long-lived assets that have been previously bought, for which there is a concrete plan to dispose of the asset by sale.
Amount of investment in land held for sale.

column3: Other Capital Assets, Not Being Depreciated
column10: Other capital assets, classified as not being depreciated. Land, for example is considered inexhaustible.
column11: Capital Assets, Not Being Depreciated at Beginning of Period
column12: Capital Assets, Not Being Depreciated at End of Period
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1400; Paragraph: 103

column10: Capital assets, classified as not being depreciated. Land, for example is considered inexhaustible.
column11: Capital Assets, Not Being Depreciated, Beginning of Period
column12: Capital Assets, Not Being Depreciated, End of Period
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1400; Paragraph: 103

column10: Other capital assets not elsewhere reported including both capital assets being depreciated, and capital assets not being depreciated.
column14: All other capital assets (Account No 150-151 156-179)
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1400; Paragraph: 103

column10: The cumulative amount of depreciation and amortization expense that has been recorded from the time the assets were put into service until the date of the balance sheet.

column3: Other Capital Assets, Being Depreciated (Net of Accumulated Depreciation and Amortization)
column10: Other capital assets, classified as depreciable, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1400; Paragraph: 103

column3: Capital Assets, Being Depreciated (Net of Accumulated Depreciation and Amortization)
column10: Capital assets, classified as depreciable, net of accumulated depreciation and amortization.
column11: Capital Assets, Being Depreciated (Net of Accumulated Depreciation and Amortization) at Beginning of Period
column12: Capital Assets, Being Depreciated (Net of Accumulated Depreciation and Amortization) at End of Period
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: 1400; Paragraph: 103

column10: The excess of net position in a pension system to the total pension liability. It should be measured as the portion of the actuarial present value of projected payments that is attributable to past periods of employee service, net of the pension plans fiduciary net position.
column14: OTHER LONG TERM ASSETS, Net Pension Asset (Account No 190)

column10: The net OPEB Asset is computed as the difference between the actuarial present value of projected benefit payments attributed to past periods of employee service and the OPEB plans fiduciary net position.
column14: OTHER LONG TERM ASSETS, Net OPEB Asset (Account No 191)

column3: Unamortized Discounts on Bonds Sold by Local Unit
column10: The excess of the face value of bonds over the amount received from the sale which remains to be amortized over the remaining life of the bonds.
Other assets that are not easily convertible to cash or not expected to become cash within the next year.
Assets held by the local government unit that are not expected to be consumed within one year.
Resources with present service capacity that the government presently controls.
column14: TOTAL ASSETS
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Paragraph: 8-16; Appendix: B-GASB Concepts Statement 4

column10: Information about deferred outflows of resources.

column3: Deferred Outflows of Resources, Debt Items
column10: A consumption of debt related net assets that applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an outflow of resources (expense/expenditure) until then.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: D20; Paragraph: 114

column3: Deferred Outflows of Resources, Pension Items, Contributions Made After Measurement Date
column10: A consumption of pension related net assets due to contributions to the pension plan made subsequent to the measurement date and prior to the reporting date. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an outflow of resources (expense/expenditure) until then.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: P20; Paragraph: 133

column3: Deferred Outflows of Resources, Pension Items, Net Difference Projected and Actual Earnings on Pension Plan Investments

column3: Deferred Outflows of Resources, Pension Items, Difference between Expected and Actual Experience
column10: A consumption of pension related net assets deferred due to differences between expected and actuarial experience with regard to economic or demographic factors. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an outflow of resources (expense/expenditure) until then.

column3: Deferred Outflows of Resources, Pension Items, Changes in Assumptions
column10: A consumption of pension related net assets deferred due to changes in assumptions about future economic and demographic factors such as inflation, health care costs trend rates, salary changes, ad hoc post?employment benefit changes, and mortality rates. Applies to a future period(s) and so will not be recognized as an outflow of resources (expense/expenditure) until then.
column17: Publisher: GASB; Name: Codification; Section: P20; Paragraph: 132a(2)
